title: [Large-scale] Simulation-Based Control Techniques for Nonlinear Systems

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of fundamental control theory and mathematical modeling
context.additional_context: A short-term intensive course accessible in mobile environments for practicing professionals, requiring learning design centered on smartphones considering PC-free settings

learning_goals: Learners can understand state constraints in nonlinear systems and explain BLF (Barrier Lyapunov Function)-based control strategies
Design and implement a controller to stabilize nonlinear systems under uncertainty using simulation tools
Apply adaptive neural network control techniques to maintain system output error within acceptable limits

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
